comment: People exaggerate. This class isn't easy, no, but just go to class and follow directions. The tests are long and difficult but if you can write, you'll do well. Lasher is an excellent teacher and definitely one of the best I've had. You will learn a lot because you have to know it, and I enjoyed it. He's a pretty funny dude, you guys sack up!

The other negative reviewers summed it up well enough. his class is a huge time sink. a lot of very intensive coursework and his grading procedures vary depending on how much effort he thinks you put in. criteria for success incredibly vague/nonexistent. mandatory attendance, but don't expect to learn much in class.

no respect for students' time...or students.  essay tests requiring research/sources (you better have a 6 hour block of time on whatever day he decides to give the test), "team project"  criteria not defined. take this with ANYONE else.

Unreasonable. He is very experienced in his field, but has no idea how to convey it. Any information outside of what he says is useless. Not lenient AT ALL on answers to tests and discussions. What he says is the holy script. Come to class, memorize everything he says, and you might do ok. He takes off unreasonably on assignments.

WORSE TEACHER EVER. how can the max. grade between his 2 classes be an 80 on a team's agreement amongst themselves? isn't the point of a team operating agreement be based off of what the team wants? He gives the dumbest assignments that teach you nothing. I can honestly say that he is the worse teacher i have ever had. and he is BORING!

Great professor! I actually learned a lot from him! Best professor at KSU, especially as far as online goes. & I hate school. It's a lot of work, but some is pretty easy. Discussions weekly, two group projects. He ended class a week early which was awesome!

Really enjoyed Lash.I didn't realize at the time but I learned alot from him.  He grades pretty weird meaning there is really no standard.He's very approachable and those who don't like him just don't like to do work.The assignments are annoying but not a hard class at all.He repeats himself alot but after a while it turns funny.Overall liked him.

I posted a while back and it isn't here anymore so to sum it up again....he was very cocky and not helpful when you were confused. His tone of voice was very demeaning to his students. I would never recommend this professor to anyone! His instructions were unclear and use unfair grading policies.

BY FAR THE WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE HAD IN MY 3 YRS OF ATTENDING KSU!He needs to learn how to talk to students in a respectable manner. He demands from you as if you are in elementary school and several times got on to students about not having work done before the due date...which is the reason there is a due date.Very rude and not motivating at al1

I had laster for 3 classes and was the professor I picked to do my hooding at graduation. Great guy and excellent instructor. Be prepaired to work. You will work for your grade. Your grade depends on the effort and quality you put in the class.

Unfair grading policy. Harry doesn't set a standard for a grade, but determines it compared to other students. I did learn a lot in his class, but Harry has too much emphasis on projects rather than theory.
Very caring about his students.  He is also very demanding.
High standards & demanding, but really cares that students are learning.  Not tollerant of those passing through to get their ticket punched, but not too tough.  Test is ultra easy IF you prepare.
Good class.  Good Professor.  Course was short on significant application of topics to real life scenarios.
All-around great professor.  Cares about his students learning.
